sn9.3:1.1: Kassapagotta appears also in AN 3.91, where he initially resents the training before repenting.
sn9.3:1.2: Cheta (variants ceṭa, ceta) is unsatisfactory. Commentary explains as “deer hunter”, apparently from the root chid (“cut, destroy”; cf. Sanskrit chettṛ). A “nimrod” is both a “hunter” and an “idiot”.
sn9.3:2.3: Read bhikkhu here as vocative.
